TopicTitle: How do you say hello in Kerbal?

Articles.Content: I've been blowing up rockets and killing/stranding Kerbals for a few months now. Done a lot of lurking in the past to try and figure things out. Figured I may as well make an account so uh...yeah here I am!
Welcome to the forums! Please dont tell me.... Jebadiah is KIA.. Anyway, looking forward to what you can show off.

I think hello in Kerbese is aloh...

Welcome aboard!
Hello hello! You can say "hello" just however you fancy here, we don't judge
aloh! That's how the kerbals would say it, but we don't care about how you say hi. Also, welcome to the forums and we hope you have a good time with the wonderful community!
Funny enough, "aloh" is "hello?" (as in when you say "hello?" when you call someone on the telephone) in Persian.

*stands on soapbox*

According to Starwhip from a previous post, it's backwards Spanish.

*leaves soapbox*

aloh!

Not Aloha

welcome aboard!
Oh, not just according to Starwhip. I forget which of the devs said it ages ago, but they indeed confirmed it was reversed Spanish.

What I keep forgetting is: do you only reverse the words or the whole sentence?

And welcome to the forums!

You won't find a nicer community out there! (Really!)

Welcome to the forums! Please dont tell me.... Jebadiah is KIA.. Anyway, looking forward to what you can show off.

Oh no of course not! Jeb is as healthy as can be. Some of the other guys, not so much. I try to do a fairly good job at keeping them alive. If Jeb is in any sort of danger of dying, then he doesn't go and somebody else takes his place.

I think hello in Kerbese is aloh...

Welcome aboard!

Doh that's right! I had somehow forgotten the secrets to the Kerbal language.

Edited May 26, 2015 by 4a6562
